title.narrative: ENHANCED CAPACITY FOR NUTRITION GOVERNANCE AT CENTRAL AND DECENTRALIZED LEVELS

description.narrative: Enhanced capacity for nutrition governance at both central and decentralized levels, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children under 5, pregnant and lactating women, and adolescents have access to and utilize quality and effective nutrition services, and adopt improved nutrition practices

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STATISTICS OF RWANDA NISR

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support, including work on the Code of Marketing of Breastmilk Substitutes
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting and wasting (excludes intervention specific strategies)
Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (early childhood nutrition)
Technical assistance - Early detection and treatment of malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity for nutrition governance at both central and decentralized levels

description.narrative: Capacity for nutrition governance was strengthened at both central and decentralized level in policy development, planning and coordination (to ensure effective use of resources, avoid duplication and increase synergies between interventions). This included supporting the development of the nutrition policy aligned with national and global priorities and strategies. UNICEF continued its partnership with FFRP to ensure high-level advocacy to keep nutrition at the top of national priorities. UNICEF collaboration with RMI will build district capacity on results-based planning and budgeting for nutrition. Nutrition budget briefs analysing the size and composition of budget allocations to nutrition interventions were also developed. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
